snippet: Two police officers have been sentenced to seven years in prison for beating to death a Shiite opposition activist in custody during last year’s crackdown on protesters.
abstract: Two police officers in Bahrain are sentenced to seven years in prison for beating death of Shiite opposition activist Kareem Fakhrawi, who was taken into custody in 2011 crackdown on protesters.
lead_paragraph: Two police officers have been sentenced to seven years in prison for beating to death a Shiite opposition activist in custody during last year’s crackdown on protesters.

headline.seo: 2 Sentenced in Beating Death in Bahrain

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
